column2: Before sending out my agents to search for a Chinese artifact I need to tell them just what I am looking for. It will probably take more time and money to find a higher quality artifact, and I will probably need to pay more for it in the end, but depending on my interests that might be worth it.
Get me something rare and expensive!

My agents have finally managed to locate an individual that is prepared to sell me a Chinese artifact through a series of intermediaries, quite possibly fearing the possibility of the buyer electing to take it by force. If I want the artifact, I will have to pay for it.
I think you will find my offer sufficient...
It is too expensive for me...
My agents have not yet managed to find a suitable Chinese artifact, and the funds I have allocated to them have all but run out. If I want them to continue, it will cost me more.
I won't throw good money after bad...
I have just been informed that a minor functionariy in [artifact_province.GetName] has died and that he apparently has seen fit to leave me an artifact of his, which was most unexpected.

Today when I toured the markets in [artifact_province.GetName] one of the merchants requested to speak to me. Apparently she recently came into possession of a Chinese artifact, which she would be willing to sell to me. She did not seem interested in haggling.
